summary: This document is an email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details logistical planning for trips to Stockholm, Sweden, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach for victim interviews and meetings, including flight and hotel bookings, per diem issues, and internal approvals.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Coordinates travel logistics, including hotel and flight bookings, for the investigation team traveling for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The official who approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Cc'd on a travel approval email; appears to be part of the office administration.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Cc'd on multiple travel approval emails related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Alleyne seeks Tyrrell's approval for travel-related expenses and logistics for the investigation team.
Both are cc'd on internal emails coordinating travel for the Epstein investigation.
Tyrrell is copied on emails to Duncan regarding travel approvals for the investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested permission to travel to West Palm Beach for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approved a travel request for the Epstein investigation team to conduct meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The U.S. Attorney's Office team was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple locations (Stockholm, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach) as part of the Epstein investigation in 2019-2020.
Travel requests required specific approval for booking conference rooms at hotels to conduct interviews, indicating formal interview settings were used.
The email chain shows detailed logistical planning, including efforts to comply with per diem allowances and preferences for domestic carrier flights.
Multiple travel requests are framed as 'similar to prior requests in connection with the Epstein investigation', indicating a pattern of investigative travel.
